page.title: 02BRAILES,ANCIENT SETTLEMENT
page.content: Old documents show that the name of the village was not always spelt "Brailes"{ Some spellings used between the 12th and 17th centuries are:Breilles Brailis,Braeles,Brales,Breiles, Braylles,Breyles,Brelis,Breles,Brayles There are two schools of thought as to the origin of the name.One is that a form of the Old English word for a burial place was "braegels".This may well derive from the existence of a long barrow at Highwall Spinney. The second is the suggestion that the Celtic "bre" meaning hill, coupled with "lis" meaning a chieftain's residence, is really the derivation of the name.Thus the two dominant features of the village _ Brailes Hill and the fortified encampment of Castle Hill _ are linked, giving much support to this theory.
